roleset.name: to make stable, making/becoming stable
roleset.note: STABILIZE-V NOTES: VN class other_cos-45.4 (from stabilize.01-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Or [*] to supply enough money [0]-1 [*T*-1] to meet the increased demand and stabilize the exchange rate , as the Chancellor argued [*?*] , and ensure the permanence of this policy by [*-2] joining the EMS .

example.name: intransitive with Arg2
example.text: The unit stabilized about midday New York time at around 1.85 marks and 141 yen , [*] prompting unconfirmed rumors that the U.S. Federal Reserve had intervened [*-1]to blunt the unit 's tumble .
example.arg: [*] prompting unconfirmed rumors that the U.S. Federal Reserve had intervened [*-1]to blunt the unit 's tumble

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: The patentee took numerous affirmative steps to perpetuate its stabilization of the market.

roleset.name: to keep or put in a stable
roleset.note: STABLE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'stable' based on dictionary.com. Verbnet entry 9.10. frame by Perryn (from stable.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: horses
example.text: John stabled the horses in the barn for the night.

roleset.name: maintaining equilibrium
roleset.note: STABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data. Relation to stabilize-v.01, which is a member of other_cos-45.5. (from stable.01-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: In Gainesville on Monday, the average price for a gallon of regular gasoline was stable at about $3.55, according to GasBuddy.com.
example.arg: the average price for a gallon of regular gasoline
